label: Security Patch Level
command: PATCH_DATE=$(getprop ro.build.version.security_patch 2>/dev/null); if [ -z "$PATCH_DATE" ]; then echo 'UNKNOWN'; exit 1; fi; PATCH_EPOCH=$(date -d "$PATCH_DATE" +%s 2>/dev/null || echo 0); CURRENT_EPOCH=$(date +%s); DAYS_OLD=$(( ($CURRENT_EPOCH - $PATCH_EPOCH) / 86400 )); if [ $DAYS_OLD -lt 90 ]; then echo "RECENT: $PATCH_DATE ($DAYS_OLD days old)"; else echo "OUTDATED: $PATCH_DATE ($DAYS_OLD days old)"; fi
description: Security patch must be less than 90 days old

label: Secure Simple Pairing (SSP)
command: dumpsys bluetooth_manager 2>/dev/null | grep -iq 'Secure Simple Pairing.*Enabled' && echo Enabled || echo Disabled
description: Checks if SSP is enabled (downgrade attacks like KNOB are prevented).

label: Bluedroid Stack Active
command: [ $(getprop ro.bluetooth.stack 2>/dev/null | grep -i bluedroid | wc -l) -gt 0 ] && echo VULNERABLE || echo SAFE
description: Detects if Bluedroid stack is active (BlueBorne vulnerable; upgrade to Fluoride recommended).

label: Bluetooth Firmware Files
description: Checks for signed Bluetooth firmware blobs (missing may mean tampering or custom build).

label: Raw Radio Device Nodes
description: Exposes low-level radio nodes. Presence may indicate increased attack surface.

label: bluetoothd Hardening
command: (ps -A -o cmd 2>/dev/null | grep -E 'bluetoothd|bluetooth' | grep -q -- -n) && echo HARDENED || echo UNPROTECTED
description: Checks if the Bluetooth daemon runs in hardened (no-privilege) mode.

label: BR/EDR Secure Connections
command: settings get global bluetooth_br_edr_secure_connections 2>/dev/null | grep -q '^1$' && echo Enforced || echo NotEnforced
description: Should return 'Enforced' to guarantee strong encryption (prevents KNOB attack).

label: SELinux Bluetooth Policy
description: SELinux domain for Bluetooth should be restrictive to prevent privilege escalation.

label: BLE MAC Randomization
command: VAR=$(settings get global bluetooth_address_rotation_enabled 2>/dev/null); if [ -z "$VAR" ]; then echo NotSupported; elif [ "$VAR" = "1" ]; then echo Enabled; else echo Disabled; fi
description: Should be enabled to randomize BLE MAC (prevents device tracking/leakage).

description: Only system keyboards must be installed

label: Test-keys Build
description: Test-keys in fingerprint indicates insecure engineering/debug build

label: Boot Image Tampered
result:
ls: /init: Permission denied
ls: /init.rc: No such file or directory
description: Check for unusual file sizes or dates

label: System Partition Tampering
description: Detects immutability or possible tampering

label: Kernel Hardening (PAN/UAO)
description: Privileged Access Never (PAN) and User Access Override (UAO) should be enabled for memory protection

label: Kernel Pointer Leaking
description: Kernel pointers should not be exposed (2 = full restriction)

label: Recent Kernel Crashes
description: Recent kernel panics or fatal errors

label: Application Crash Log
description: Recent app crash logs (look for repeated exceptions)

label: SELinux AVC Denials
description: Check for any denied SELinux actions

label: Suspicious Packages
description: Flag suspicious package names

label: Sensitive/Malicious Files (Recursive)
description: Finds files on external storage commonly linked to leaks or malware (recursively).

label: Device Admin Apps
description: Device admin apps have elevated privileges

label: Device Owner Set
description: Device owner (MDM) presence

label: Work Profile Present
description: Work profile / managed profile detection

label: Profile Owner Apps
description: Profile owner apps managing work profile

label: Unknown MDM Apps
description: Known MDM solution packages

label: Factory Reset Protection
description: Factory Reset Protection should be enabled

label: Device Provisioned
description: Device setup completion status

label: Stack Canaries
description: Stack canaries should be enabled to prevent buffer overflows

label: ROP Mitigation (PAC)
description: Pointer Authentication (PAC) should be enabled to prevent ROP attacks

label: Memory Tagging (MTE)
description: Memory Tagging Extension (MTE) should be enabled for JIT hardening

label: DNS Servers
description: Check DNS configs

label: World-Writable Files
description: Unprotected sensitive files

label: Wi-Fi Security (WPA3)
description: WPA3 should be preferred over WPA2 for stronger Wi-Fi security

label: DNS-over-TLS Enabled
description: DNS-over-TLS (DoT) should be enabled for encrypted DNS

label: ARP Table Dump
result: IP address       HW type     Flags       HW address            Mask     Device
description: Lists resolved ARP IP-MAC mappings

label: Proxy Configuration
description: Proxy set may indicate MITM or forced redirection

label: Captive Portal Detection
description: Should be 1 (default); 0 disables captive portal checks

label: All Active TCP Connections (IPv4)
description: Lists all IPv4 TCP connections including localhost — use for full socket audit

label: Common TCP Ports Exposed (IPv4, Warning)
description: One or more common TCP ports are externally accessible on IPv4 — review exposure

label: Expanded Critical TCP Ports (excluding SSH) Listening or External (IPv4)
description: One or more critical TCP ports (excluding SSH) are open or externally connected (IPv4) — review exposure

label: Open UDP Ports (IPv4, excluding localhost)
description: Open UDP ports (IPv4) found that are not restricted to localhost

label: UDP Ports 123, 161, 162, 5353 Open (IPv4)
description: UDP Ports 123 (NTP), 161 (SNMP), 162 (Trap), or 5353 (mDNS) are exposed on IPv4 — may leak device or service data

label: Potentially Vulnerable UDP Ports (IPv4)
description: One or more UDP ports (e.g., 69/TFTP, 1900/SSDP) are exposed on IPv4 — potentially vulnerable services detected

label: All Active TCP Connections (IPv6, excluding ::1)
description: Displays all active IPv6 TCP connections (including LISTEN/ESTABLISHED) that are not bound to loopback (::1)

label: Common TCP Ports Exposed (IPv6, Warning)
description: One or more common TCP ports are externally accessible on IPv6 — review exposure

label: Expanded Critical TCP Ports (excluding SSH) Listening or External (IPv6)
description: One or more critical TCP ports (excluding SSH) are open or externally connected (IPv6) — review exposure

label: Open UDP Ports (IPv6, excluding localhost)
description: Open UDP ports (IPv6) found that are not restricted to localhost (::1)

label: UDP Ports 123, 161, 162, 5353 Open (IPv6)
description: UDP Ports 123 (NTP), 161 (SNMP), 162 (Trap), or 5353 (mDNS) are exposed on IPv6 — may leak device or service data

label: Potentially Vulnerable UDP Ports (IPv6)
description: One or more UDP ports (e.g., 69/TFTP, 1900/SSDP) are exposed on IPv6 — potentially vulnerable services detected

label: NFC Enabled
description: NFC should be disabled when not in use to prevent skimming attacks

label: Android Beam Enabled
description: Android Beam can be used for unauthorized data transfer

label: NFC Payment Default App
description: Default NFC payment application

label: HCE Payment Apps
description: Host Card Emulation payment apps installed

label: NFC Secure Element
description: NFC Secure Element support for secure transactions

label: OTA Update Path
description: OTA incremental version for build tracking

label: Writable Paths in $PATH
command: echo $PATH | tr ':' '\n' | awk 'NF' | xargs -I{} sh -c '[ -w "{}" ] && echo "{}"'
description: Writable dirs in PATH can lead to privilege escalation

label: Disable-Verity Property Not Set
description: Disable-verity must not be enabled on locked devices

label: Systemless Root Path

description: Magisk binary indicates systemless root

label: su Binary in Common Paths
description: su binary indicates rooted device

label: Screen Lock Enabled
description: Screen lock must be enabled (not 0=none or 65536=swipe)

label: Lock Screen Timeout
description: Screen timeout value in milliseconds

label: Show Password Characters
description: Password characters should not be shown

label: Lock Screen Notifications
description: Sensitive notifications visible on lock screen

label: Overlay Permission Apps
command: pm list packages -e 2>/dev/null | xargs -I{} sh -c 'dumpsys package {} 2>/dev/null | grep -q SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW && echo {}' | wc -l
description: Apps with overlay permission can capture input

label: Screen Capture Disabled
description: Enterprise policy may disable screenshots

label: Lockdown on Failed Attempts
description: Maximum unlock attempts before lockdown

label: Quick Settings Tiles on Lock
description: Quick settings accessible from lock screen

label: SELinux Status
description: SELinux must be in Enforcing mode for proper security

label: SELinux Policy Version
description: SELinux policy version (higher is better, 30+ recommended)

label: SELinux Deny Unknown
description: Unknown access should be denied by default

label: SELinux Permissive Domains
description: No domains should be running in permissive mode

label: SELinux Boot Parameter
description: SELinux should not be disabled via boot parameter

label: SIM Card Present
description: SIM card status

label: SIM PIN Lock Enabled
command: service call iphonesubinfo 3 2>/dev/null | grep -q 'PIN' && echo ENABLED || echo DISABLED
description: SIM PIN lock prevents unauthorized SIM use

label: SIM Operator
description: Current mobile operator

label: Dual SIM Status
description: Dual SIM configuration

label: eSIM Profiles
description: eSIM management apps present

label: Carrier Lock Status
description: Carrier/network lock status

label: bootctl Present
command: command -v bootctl >/dev/null 2>&1 && echo present || echo absent
description: bootctl available to query slot state

label: Current Slot
description: Device reports current boot slot (a/b or 0/1)

label: Stock Recovery (No TWRP in PATH)
command: command -v twrp >/dev/null 2>&1 && echo found || echo notfound
description: No custom recovery binary should be present

label: Hidden or Extra Partitions
description: Detects non-standard or extra partitions

label: SDCard Mount RW
description: SDCard should not be mounted read-write in restricted environments

label: Orphaned Files in /data
description: Looks for files owned by root but not by 'system' user

label: External Storage Encryption
description: External storage filenames should be encrypted

label: Kernel Version
description: Kernel build/version details

label: Audit Logs Enabled
description: Non-zero values indicate audit logs may be active

label: ASLR Enabled
description: ASLR must be enabled (value 2) to randomize memory layout and protect against memory-based attacks.

label: KASLR Enabled
description: Kernel Address Space Layout Randomization (KASLR) should be enabled to randomize kernel memory layout.

label: NX (No eXecute) Bit Enabled
description: NX bit must be enabled to prevent execution of code in data memory regions.

label: Core Dumps Disabled
description: Core dumps should be disabled to prevent sensitive data leakage.

label: SECCOMP Enabled
description: SECCOMP must be enabled to restrict system calls.

label: Kernel Modules Loading Restricted
description: Kernel module loading should be disabled after boot to prevent unauthorized module insertion.

label: Protected Symlinks Enabled
description: Symlink protection should be enabled to prevent symlink-based privilege escalation.

label: Protected Hardlinks Enabled
description: Hardlink protection should be enabled to prevent unauthorized file access.

label: dmesg Restriction Enabled
description: Restricting dmesg access prevents unprivileged users from reading kernel logs.

label: TEE Driver Presence
description: TEE driver (Trusted Execution Environment) should exist on modern secure devices

label: TPM Keystore Presence
description: Checks for hardware-backed keystore modules

label: TEE Vendor Prop
description: Shows any TEE-related properties

label: MTP Access Enabled
description: MTP allows file access over USB - review if needed

label: USB OTG Enabled
description: USB OTG status for external device connections

label: USB Accessory Mode
description: USB accessory/host mode configuration

label: Unauthorized ADB Connections
description: Too many authorized ADB keys may indicate unauthorized access

label: USB Data Signaling Disabled
description: USB data signaling control (Android 13+)

label: Screen Lock
description: Screen lock must be enabled

label: Clipboard Access
description: Check if clipboard has sensitive data

label: Location Services
description: Mode 3 means high-accuracy enabled

label: Clipboard History
description: Clipboard history should be disabled to prevent data leaks

label: Biometric Strength
description: Biometric auth should be 'STRONG' (not 'WEAK')

label: Backup Allowed
description: Auto-backup should be disabled for sensitive apps

label: Fingerprint / Setup Complete
description: Check if device setup is complete

label: Trust Agents Enabled
description: May allow unlock bypass via smart lock
